page.title: 17CHANGING TIMES continued.
page.content: Saturday night. {Public Houses.}The boarding house, Dene Holme, was a hotel.There was the Riding Hotel, the Dale Hotel, the Heatherlea Hotel, the Hotspur Hotel, the Golden Lion, the Hare and Hounds, the Allendale and the Kings Head. { {Transport. }Transport now is very expensive;it is Â£1.80 to Hexham and back.It used to be 2/6 (12\p) in the 1930's. {Churches.}In 1930 nearly all the churches were the same as now. The Methodist Church at Dawson Place closed and is now used as a library. It is still possible to get up to the balcony and sit in the pews.
